good_characteristics: Published in peer-reviewed, well-known conferences or journals
Clear evidence of your authorship role (first author, corresponding author)
Demonstrates impact through citations or acceptance rates
Includes complete publication proof (full paper, not just abstract)
bad_characteristics: No evidence of impact or recognition

good_example.title: Conference Paper at NeurIPS 2023

fields.name: publication_title
fields.value: Efficient Transformer Architectures for Low-Resource Language Processing

fields.name: journal_name
fields.value: Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS)

good_example.why_this_is_good: NeurIPS is a top-tier, highly selective conference (acceptance rate ~26%). The applicant is first author, showing leadership. Citations demonstrate real-world impact. Complete documentation is provided.

bad_example.title: ArXiv Preprint
bad_example.why_this_is_bad: ArXiv is not peer-reviewed. The title is vague. Author role is unclear (which position among co-authors?). No citations or evidence of impact. Only a preprint link without any peer-reviewed acceptance.

good_characteristics: Reviewing for prestigious, well-known conferences or journals
Clear documentation of your reviewer status (invitation letters, certificates)
Multiple review assignments showing ongoing trusted role
Evidence of senior reviewing positions (area chair, senior PC member)
bad_characteristics: Reviewing for unknown or low-tier venues

good_example.title: Senior Program Committee Member, ICML 2024

fields.name: role_description
fields.value: Senior Program Committee Member (Area Chair) for Deep Learning track

fields.name: number_reviewed
fields.value: Managed meta-review of 28 submissions, directly reviewed 6 papers

good_example.why_this_is_good: ICML is a premier conference. Senior PC/Area Chair is a prestigious role showing trust from the community. Specific numbers provided. Official documentation including invitation and certificate.

bad_example.title: Reviewer for Various Journals
bad_example.why_this_is_bad: No specific journal names mentioned. Vague role and impact. No quantifiable review count. Poor documentation (screenshot instead of official letters). Doesn't demonstrate standing in the field.

good_characteristics: Specific, quantifiable impact (users, stars, citations, adoption)
Clear explanation of innovation and why it matters
Evidence of widespread adoption or recognition
Multiple forms of proof (code, documentation, testimonials, metrics)
bad_characteristics: Common work that many others have done
No evidence of adoption or recognition

good_example.title: Open-Source Framework: FastInference

fields.name: work_description
fields.value: Created FastInference, an open-source optimization framework that reduces ML model inference latency by 60% while maintaining accuracy. Introduced novel quantization techniques now adopted by major tech companies.

fields.name: impact_description
fields.value: Downloaded 2.3M times, 15K GitHub stars, used in production by 40+ companies including Microsoft and Uber. Cited in 89 academic papers. Reduced inference costs by estimated $50M+ across industry.

good_example.why_this_is_good: Concrete, quantifiable metrics showing widespread adoption. Clear innovation explained. Multiple credible sources of evidence. Demonstrates significant industry impact.

bad_example.title: Personal Project

fields.name: work_description
fields.value: Built a web application for task management with some cool features.

fields.name: impact_description
fields.value: My friends and colleagues found it useful. It's a pretty good app that solves problems.

bad_example.why_this_is_bad: Vague descriptions without specifics. No quantifiable impact. Limited adoption (37 stars is modest). Common type of project. Minimal documentation. Doesn't demonstrate extraordinary ability.

good_characteristics: Nationally or internationally recognized awards
Highly selective (acceptance rate, competition details)
Relevant to your field of expertise
Official documentation from credible organizations
bad_characteristics: Internal company awards or participation certificates

good_example.title: Best Paper Award at ACL 2023

fields.name: selection_criteria
fields.value: Selected as the single best paper from 1,350+ submissions (0.07% selection rate) by the program committee based on originality, impact, and technical quality.

good_example.why_this_is_good: Prestigious, internationally recognized conference. Extremely selective (1 out of 1,350+). Clear criteria. Official documentation from credible organization. Demonstrates excellence.

bad_example.title: Employee of the Month

fields.name: selection_criteria
fields.value: Given to employees who perform well each month.

bad_example.why_this_is_bad: Internal company award, not nationally/internationally recognized. Given monthly (not highly selective). Vague criteria. Doesn't demonstrate extraordinary ability compared to peers in the field.

good_characteristics: Coverage in major, well-known publications
Focused on your work or achievements (not just mentioned)
Multiple independent articles from credible sources
Trade publications relevant to your field

good_example.title: Feature in TechCrunch

fields.name: article_title
fields.value: How This AI Researcher's Breakthrough Is Changing Healthcare Diagnostics

good_example.why_this_is_good: TechCrunch is a major, internationally recognized tech publication. Article focuses specifically on the applicant's work. Clear subject matter relevance. Credible, independent journalism.

bad_example.title: Local Newsletter Mention
bad_example.why_this_is_bad: Local, limited-circulation publication. Brief mention, not focused on applicant's work. No demonstration of national/international recognition. Screenshot instead of official article.

good_characteristics: Membership requires outstanding achievements (not just paying dues)
Highly selective organizations with rigorous admission criteria
Nationally or internationally recognized associations
Clear documentation of selection process and your qualifications
bad_characteristics: Organizations open to anyone who pays membership fees
No selection criteria or vetting process

good_example.title: ACM Distinguished Member

fields.name: selection_criteria
fields.value: Requires at least 15 years of professional experience and 5 years of continuous ACM Professional Membership. Nominated by peers and selected based on significant accomplishments and impact in computing. Only top 10% of ACM members achieve this distinction.

good_example.why_this_is_good: Highly selective honor requiring outstanding achievements. Clear, rigorous criteria. Internationally recognized organization. Requires nomination and peer selection. Complete documentation provided.

bad_example.title: IEEE Student Member

fields.name: organization_name
fields.value: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)

fields.name: selection_criteria
fields.value: Open to any student enrolled in relevant degree programs who pays annual dues.

bad_example.why_this_is_bad: Open membership requiring only dues payment. No selection based on achievements. Student membership level. Doesn't demonstrate outstanding ability. Poor documentation quality.

good_characteristics: Leadership position with significant organizational impact
Clear evidence of how your role was critical to success
Quantifiable results and responsibilities
Documentation from the organization confirming your role and impact

good_example.title: Head of AI Research, TechCorp

fields.name: key_responsibilities
fields.value: Lead a team of 35 AI researchers and engineers. Established the company's AI research division from scratch, securing $15M annual budget. Directed development of core AI technologies now used by 50M+ users. Set technical strategy for all ML initiatives. Published 12 papers at top conferences under my leadership.

good_example.why_this_is_good: Senior leadership position at reputable company. Quantifiable impact (team size, budget, users). Clear critical role in establishing new division. Multiple forms of documentation from the organization.

bad_example.title: Software Engineer

fields.name: key_responsibilities
fields.value: Worked on various projects as part of the engineering team. Contributed to product development and helped with technical tasks.

bad_example.why_this_is_bad: Standard role, not leadership or critical position. Vague responsibilities without measurable impact. Short tenure. Minimal documentation. Doesn't demonstrate how role was essential to organization.

good_characteristics: Compensation significantly above national average for the field
Complete documentation (paystubs, offer letters, W-2s)
Comparison data showing top percentile standing
Includes all components: base, bonus, equity
bad_characteristics: Salary at or below average for the field and location

good_example.title: Senior ML Engineer Compensation

fields.name: salary
fields.value: $425,000 base + $150,000 annual bonus + $300,000 equity/year = $875,000 total compensation

good_example.why_this_is_good: Very high compensation clearly documented. Well above national average for ML engineers (typically $150-250K). Complete financial records including paystubs and W-2. Comparison data showing top percentile. All compensation components included.

bad_example.title: Developer Salary
bad_example.why_this_is_bad: Salary around or below national average for software developers. Only one paystub provided (need 4). No comparison data to demonstrate high standing. Missing documentation like offer letter or W-2. Doesn't show top percentile compensation.
